data.title: 12 Places To Visit In Caloocan That Will Make Your Trip Fun
data.meta_description: These 12 places to visit in Caloocan will make your vacation in the city more interesting and worth remembering. Make a visit here with your family or friends!
data.text:
Cover Image Credit: Wikipedia

Caloocan is a first class highly urbanized city in the Metro Manila, Philippines. With a population of over one million people, this has become the fourth most populous city in Metro Manila, Philippines. The total area of this place is approx five thousand hectares thus becoming the second largest city in Manila area wise.

Caloocan city was founded in the year 1815 this city was initially a low land area with not much importance given to it. But eventually it evolved as one of the most developed and advanced cities of Manila. The geographical area of Manila is divided in to two non-contagious lands which are known as the southern Caloocan and the northern Caloocan.

This city is divided into 188 Barangay or so called the zone system. There are many places to visit in Caloocan where the tourists find so many options to shop from and try the local food at.

12 Places To Visit In Caloocan

Caloocan is one of those cities in Philippines which are filled with hustle and fast-paced lifestyle. It is located in the north of Metro Manila province. With huge historical museums to ancient churches this city reflects its rich heritage and culture through its centuries old monuments and the exquisite architecture.

To reach this beautiful city, there are several options available like bus, taxis, or jeeps. But it is highly recommended to use railway systems as it is more convenient to travel. This city has an abundance of cultural gems to be discovered.

12 Places To Visit In Caloocan City

Check out the list of places to visit in Caloocan City which you should definitely visit on your vacation. Keep scrolling down and read along!

San Roque Cathedral

University of Santo Tomas Museum

La Mesa watershed

Gubat Sa Ciudad

Bonifacio Circle Monumento

SM Center Sangandaan

Sto. Nino De Pajotan Festival

Taoist Temple

Green Paddle

Mister Kabab

Luzviminda

Malabon Zoo

1. San Roque Cathedral

Image Source

The San Roque Cathedral Church is one of the first churches to have establishes in this wonderful city. The specialty of this church is that it has been blessed by Pope John Paul II. People come here to worship and attain some divine peace and serenity. This church is the very pride and joy of this marvelous city.

The architecture of this church reflects the ancient time when this church was made. The interiors of this church are beautiful crafted. And it is one of the must visit places of the city.

Location- A. Mabini St, Poblacion, Caloocan, 1400 Metro Manila, Philippines

Suggested Read: Philippines Food: 10 Traditional Dishes That Every Traveler Must-Try At Least Once

2. University of Santo Tomas Museum

Image Source

The University Of Santo Tomas Museum is a place which represents the diverse culture and heritage of Filipino. The objects kept in this are not displayed for public but are also something that the students enrolled in this university have been researching on!

This museum has a variety of exhibits being displays all the time are also chancing continuously. The main exhibit here presents a collection of Gabinete De Fisica. As you walk your way through this museum, you will find yourself back in time, such is the demonstration of this place!

Location- 2nd Level, Main Building, España, Caloocan, Metro Manila, Philippines

3. La Mesa watershed

Image Source

This place is the Manila’s main source of water spread over an area of 2659 hectares. This is an area of protected wetlands. Visitors can take a tour of this park whose path is as long as 50 miles. This place is a heaven for people who love bird watching.

Here, you will find different species of bird as you take the tour in the park. Some of them are endangered as well. This park is an exquisite wildlife with a variety of flora and fauna to flourish.

Location- 4332, Quezon City Dr, Novaliches, Quezon City, Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 2 134 2814

Suggested Read: 8 Museums In Philippines: Digging Deeper Into History Culture & Arts!

4. Gubat Sa Ciudad

Image Credit: Pixel2013 by Pixabay

If you are planning to come to Caloocan with friends and family and then staying in this place would probably be the best decision of you trip. This place in itself is a tourist spot. This resort offers a variety of fun activities and opportunists to do something adventurous.

It has treehouses and playhouses for children. It has also got water slides and fountains that are spacious enough. This place also encourages sports and has both volleyball and basket ball complex.

Location- Caloocan, Metro Manila, Philippines

5. Bonifacio Circle Monumento

Image Source

This is a historical place. This is the exact place where the popular Philippines Revolution began. This place has got beautiful sculptures sculpted by Guillermo, Tolentino. He was a very well known and renowned national artist. He is a respectable man and very much heard of. The art here depicts the bravery of the Filipino soldiers. There sculptures in which they can be seen pointing arrows and in a fighting posture.

The reason why this city is proud of this place and the sculptures is because it reminds of theirs struggles and their strength that they showed in front of their enemies in past. To get the real essence of this city this place is highly recommended to visit.

Location- grace park, Caloocan, Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 2 332 2694

Suggested Read: 12 Fantastic Festivals In Philippines For Each Month of the Year

6. SM Center Sangandaan

Image Source

This is a huge three storey mall in the city which has got everything under one single roof. This mall has got IMAX theaters and toy car rides for the kids. Also on some designated days on which cartoon meet and greets take place. It is a good place to shop and have fun. This mall houses several clothing, grocery and American hardware stores.

Now, if you get tired of shopping and want to rest for a while, this place has got it covered! There are so many cafes and coffee shops and where you can simply sit and relax while sipping on some delightful coffee. Some of these food joints are Dairy Queen, Pnininjoints etc.

Location- A. Mabini St, Sangandaan, Caloocan, Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 2 946 7208

Planning your holiday but confused about where to go? These travel stories help you find your best trip ever!

Real travel stories. Real stays. Handy tips to help you make the right choice.

7. Sto. Nino De Pajotan Festival

Image Source

This is yet another famous touristy thing to do! This is a religious festival which celebrates the Filipino cultures and its rich past heritage. They worship Lord Jesus of whom they are a firm believer. This is a little different form the usual Sunday mass gatherings – the reason being splendid firework and delectable food! Attendees of this fest prepare food for a large mass.

The festival ends with spectacular fireworks display that can be seen right above the church pavilion. This is also the best way to blend with the locals and know more about them!

Suggested Read: Boracay Island: A Detailed Guide To Explore Philippines’ Little Paradise

8. Taoist Temple

Image Source

This is a tree story temple which in itself is a masterpiece. This temple is about a hundred years old! This magnificent temple is worship place for the Chinese and Chinese Filipino residents. This ancient building is a holy place where tourists can get an overview the religious beliefs of the locals.

Location- 241 M. H. Del Pilar Street, Caloocan City, Metro Manila, Philippines

9. Green Paddle

Image Source

Green paddle is a famous table tennis club of the city. If you want to brush up your skills or take them to the net level, then this is the place for you to come. Here you can personal training session with the experts of this field.

These coaches will guide you through the strategies with which you can master this game! There is also a sports store here where you can buy table tennis.

Location- Unit 34 Grace Park Commercial Complex, 4th Avenue corner A., A. Del Mundo St., Caloocan, Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 2 332 2694

Suggested Read: 8 Fascinating Things To Do In Manila To Savor The Best Of Philippines’ Culture

10. Mister Kabab

Image Source

If you have had enough of Filipino dishes in this city and want to try something new and different then this restaurant is the best choice for you. This restaurant provides you with the Middle Eastern Cuisines which are delightful to taste. The ambience and the food here is a replication of the Middle East culture. The décor of this place is something of exquisite quality.

This place is well-furnished with white wooden furniture’s well blending in with the ambience. Also the texture of vibrant turmeric yellow colour can be seen throughout the house thus making this place feel alive. If you are a sucker for nice interiors and Middle Eastern cuisines then you have got to come to this place!

Location- 31 West Ave, Quezon City, 1104 Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 2 351 2647

11. Luzviminda

Image Credit: Mohammed Hajjar by Pexles

This resort is well maintained and the decoration of this place is something that you can’t afford to miss anyhow! The vibe of this place is fun and quirky. This place has fascinating castle towers that lights up at night and it also has balloon paintings all over the walls.

Location- Teofilo Samson Ave, Caloocan City North, 1421 Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 917 795 4002

Suggested Read: Puerto Galera – A Mini Guide To The Beautiful Beach Town In Philippines

12. Malabon Zoo

Image Source

This place is a shelter for different species of flora and fauna. You will get to find different species of plants and wildlife here. This place also has an aquarium and a nice garden for picnic or usual strolling purpose. Don’t forget to add this one on your bucket list if you are nature lover!

Location- 1 Gov. Pascual Ave, Potrero, Malabon, Metro Manila, Philippines

Contact- +63 933 687 8880

Further Read: Scuba Diving in Philippines: 10 Places For An Incredible Diving Experience

Thus, if you are planning to spend your international holiday here, then make sure you include most of these places and plan your itinerary accordingly. Experience the rich cultural vibe of the city and get to know the place better during your trip with these places to visit in Caloocan city.
